question_text: Which sign makes the statement true?3529  3929><=

There are 4 digits in each number

5 is less than 9

question_text: Kayla made two paper chains. The paper links on one represented the number of days until her birthday, and the other showed the days until summer vacation. There are 3 boxes in the diagram in total

question_text: Which expression has a value of 20?
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Find the value of each expression
Start with 50 ÷ (5 x 2)
First, multiply the numbers inside the parentheses
50 ÷ (5 x 2) = 50 ÷ 10Now, divide the remaining numbers
50 ÷ 10 = 5The value of 50 ÷ (5 x 2) is 5
Now, find the value of (50 ÷ 5) x 2
First, divide the numbers inside the parentheses
(50 ÷ 5) x 2 = 10 x 2Now, multiply the remaining numbers
10 x 2 = 20The value of (50 ÷ 5) x 2 is 20
This is the correct answer

question_text: Mia bought 1 pack of white T-shirts and 2 packs of blue T-shirts for her basketball team. The white T-shirts come in packs of 8, and the blue T-shirts come in packs of 8. How many T-shirts did Mia buy in all?
solution: Step 1:Find the number of white T-shirts

8 + 16 = 24Mia bought 24 T-shirts

question_text: Christopher can make a small gift basket in 9 minutes and a large gift basket in 21 minutes. Right now he has orders for 6 small gift baskets and 3 large gift baskets. He estimates that making all the gift baskets will take 120 minutes. Is that a good estimate?
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
choices: No, it is much too high.
No, it is much too low.
solution: To check the estimate, find about how many minutes it will take to make all the gift baskets
Use numbers that are easy to work with and that are close to the numbers in the problem
The 6 small gift baskets each take 9 minutes to make
That is about 10 minutes each
Multiply: 6 x 10 = 60The 3 large gift baskets each take 21 minutes to make
That is about 20 minutes each
Multiply: 3 x 20 = 60Finally, add to estimate the total amount of time
60 + 60 = 120So, 120 minutes is a good estimate

question_text: Use the shapes to make an AB pattern

question_text: What shape comes next?
solution: We can label the rectangle as A and the circle as B. The repeating pattern is AB.
The pattern repeats over and over, so the next shape is B, the circle.

question_text: Use the shapes to continue the pattern
solution: We can label the rectangle as A and the triangle as B. The repeating pattern is AB.
The pattern repeats over and over, so the next shapes in order are A, the rectangle, then B, the circle.

question_text: What row comes next in the pattern?
solution: Count the square in the each row. Notice that the the number of square before the circle is increasing by 1 the level of row increases.
So, the next row will have 5 squares before the circle.

question_text: Pick the story that can be modelled by the equation x5=20.
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
choices: Lambert's Library is selling a total of 20 books at its annual used-book sale. The librarians divided the books evenly among 5 shelves in the library lobby. They put x books on each shelf.
Lambert's Library is selling a total of x books at its annual used-book sale. The librarians divided the books evenly among 5 shelves in the library lobby. They put 20 books on each shelf.
solution: Look for words and phrases in the first story that tell you what equation will model it
Lambert's Library is selling a total of 20 books at its annual used-book sale
The librarians divided the books evenly among 5 shelves in the library lobby
They put x books on each shelf
The librarians divided a total of 20 books evenly among 5 shelves
They put x books on each shelf
This story can be modelled by the division equation 205=x
Look for words and phrases in the second story that tell you what equation will model it
Lambert's Library is selling a total of x books at its annual used-book sale
The librarians divided the books evenly among 5 shelves in the library lobby
They put 20 books on each shelf
The librarians divided a total of x books evenly among 5 shelves
They put 20 books on each shelf
This story can be modelled by the division equation x5=20

question_text: Which type of graph would best show the number of students in each grade?

question_text: The rectangles below have the same perimeter.6 mm6 mm3 mmWhat is the area of the green rectangle?
solution: Find the perimeter of the grey rectangle
6 + 6 + 6 + 6 = 24Both rectangles have a perimeter of 24 millimetres

question_text: Which of the following is an advantage of using a credit card?
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
choices: Using a credit card means you will not have to pay interest on your purchases.
If your credit card is lost or stolen, you automatically lose your money.
Using credit cards can help you pay for emergencies when you don't have enough cash.
solution: Read each statement to see if it describes an advantage of using a credit card
If you can't pay your monthly balance, you must pay interest
If the repair is expensive enough that you will need to pay it off over time,you will owe interest
That will make the purchase more costly
This is a disadvantage,not an advantage of paying with a credit card
If your credit card is lost or stolen,you automatically lose your money
If your credit card is lost or stolen,you can report it to your financial institution
They will cancel the card so no one uses it to spend your money
You will not automatically lose your money
So,thisstatementisnottrue
You can pay for emergencies with a credit card when you don't have enough cash
Credit cards are convenient for emergencies
You may not have enough cash when an emergency happens, but you can pay quickly using a credit card
This is an advantage of paying with a credit card

solution: Step 1: Find how much money Owen needs to balance his budget

$110â$85=$25The difference is $25, so Owen needs an extra $25 to balance his budget
Step 2: Find the answer choice that gives Owen an extra $25
Increasing his income by $25 will give Owen the extra money he needs
So, Owen can balance his budget by giving a guitar lesson to earn $25

question_text: Which model represents the product 3Ã16?
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: The product 3Ã16 means 3 groups of 16
Check the first model
There are 4 shapes in the model
Each shape shows the fraction 16
In each shape, 1 part is shaded, and there are 6 equal parts
So, the entire model represents 4 groups of 16, which is 4Ã16
This is not the correct model
Check the second model
There are 3 shapes in the model
Each shape shows the fraction 16
In each shape, 1 part is shaded, and there are 6 equal parts
So, the entire model represents 3 groups of 16, which is 3Ã16
This is the correct model

question_text: Look at the following shape and select the image that shows a translation
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Image A shows a rotation
Rotate the shape 90 degrees clockwise
Image C shows a reflection
Reflect the shape across a vertical line
Image B shows a translation
Translate the shape up 1 and left 3
Image B is the correct image

question_text: This is a parallelogramWhich of the following shows the paralellogram cut and rearranged into a rectangle?What is the area of the parallelogram?__ milimetres square
question_type: Fill in the blank and Multiple Choices
solution: The parallelogram has a base of 8 milimetres and a height of 9 milimetres
You can cut and rearrange the parallelogram into a rectangle
First, cut it into two pieces along the dashed line
Then, move the triangle to the left side to form a rectangle
Note that the rectangle has sides that area the same length as the base = 8 milimetres and height = 9 milimetres of the parallelogram
So, to find the area of a parallelogram, you can multiply its base by its height

question_text: What inequality does this number line show?
solution: We want to write an equality that says x can be anything shown by the arrow and circle
The open circle located on 7 means that x cannot be equal to 7
The arrow pointing to the right means that x can be any number greater than 7
Since x can be any number greater than 7, the inequality is x > 7
